entries.title: Graduated from TU Iasi
entries.description: I have studied **Automatic Control and Computer Science** for 5 years at the Technical University of Iasi, Romania. In the fifth year I was awarded a Socrates-Erasmus scholarship to study at the University of Gent, Belgium. I finished my studies with a final mark of **9.81** out of **10**.

entries.title: Diploma Thesis
entries.description: My thesis focused on the implementation of a Model Based Predictive Control (MBPC) strategy for a switched-mode DC-DC power converter (SMPC) using a Digital Signal Processor (DSP). In addition to working on my thesis, I also followed the master courses in **Computer Control of Industrial Processes**. I got the highest mark in the class.

entries.title: Advanced Radar Sensor
entries.description: I start my career at RÃ¼cker (now EDAG AG), in Wiesbaden, Germany, as a software engineer. I was responsible for the control of the elevation motor of the ARS300 radar sensor.

entries.title: Electronic Wedge Brake
entries.description: I was recruited by Continental AG as a software engineer for the Electronic Wedge Brake (EWB) project. I was responsible for the development of monitoring and calibration routines for the EWB control unit.

entries.title: Continental Ambassadors Program
entries.description: Teaching control theory in automotive applications to master students.

entries.title: Electro-mechanical Wheel Brake (EMB)
entries.description: Software engineer for the [Audi R8 e-tron](https://www.audi-mediacenter.com/de/audi-e-tron-155) concept car electro-mechanical brake system. I was responsible for the application state machine handling different brake modes and calibration routines.

entries.title: Brushless DC Motor (BLDC) Control
entries.description: DIY project to control a BLDC motor using a micro-controller. I have designed the H-Bridge driver hardware, motor control library and a GUI to test and control the system.

entries.title: Integrated Parking Brake (IPB)
entries.description: My first multi customer safety critical project. I was responsible for the development of the IPB safety barrier. I was also the software integrator and software project manager.

entries.title: Continental Air Supply (CAirS)
entries.description: My first Autosar project. I was responsible for the Memory Stack and the Basic SW integration. I also implemented a test framework to run on the target to support basic SW integration tests.

entries.title: Signal Manipulation Application (SigMa)
entries.description: This was my first application in Python which was rolled out to be used by the vehicle test department.

entries.title: Courage - Continental C-Unit Test Framework
entries.description: My first agile project. I was responsible for the ECU target test execution and organizing trainings on how to test embedded software.

entries.title: A.SPICE Conform Review Application for GitHub Enterprise
entries.description: My first GitHub application (using Javascript). This application was developed to support the A.SPICE review process for the software development.

entries.title: MonoRepo History Cut Transformer
entries.description: My first *it must work otherwise the whole software development is blocked* project. I implemented a tool (using Gradle) to cut the history of a mono repository, restructure it and push it to a new repository.

entries.title: Phoenix - Ninja Build System Generator for C Applications
entries.description: Implementing a Ninja build system generator for C applications. We had to support custom code generators, component test reports and handling of different build configurations.

entries.title: Yet Another Architecture Description Language (YAADL) Code Generator

entries.title: Software Product Line Engineering [(SPLE)](https://github.com/avengineers/spl-core)
entries.description: My first CMake project to support engineering Software Product Lines.

entries.title: Yet Another Ninja Generator [(YANGA)](https://github.com/cuinixam/yanga)
entries.description: Teaming up with AI to develop a Python application for software product line engineering. See the YANGA presentation [here](#presentations).
